body_html:
I'm confused about split and chunk which are implemented in:

https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/functional.py

They work generically on Tensors and Parameters. It seems like they shouldn't need their own Function subclass, since calling torch.split or torch.chunk don't need it.

They work generically on Tensors and Parameters. It seems like they shouldn't need their own Function subclass, since calling torch.split or torch.chunk don't need it.
body:
I'm confused about split and chunk which are implemented in:

https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/functional.py

They work generically on Tensors and Parameters. It seems like they shouldn't need their own Function subclass, since calling `torch.split` or `torch.chunk` don't need it.
